docs.snippet: Developments in Argentina are being watched with a mixture of anxiety and hope -- mostly hope. The fall of General Peron is one of the most important events of contemporary Latin-American history. The echoes are resounding all over the world and...
docs.lead_paragraph: Developments in Argentina are being watched with a mixture of anxiety and hope -- mostly hope. The fall of General Peron is one of the most important events of contemporary Latin-American history. The echoes are resounding all over the world and doubtless they sound ominous to other dictators from Madrid to Bogota.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 22 -- A prominent Argentine exile warned today that the end of the dictatorship in Argentina could not mean the immediate return of full democracy.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 22 -- A prominent Argentine exile warned today that the end of the dictatorship in Argentina could not mean the immediate return of full democracy.
docs.abstract: Paraguayan consulate, Montevideo, says Peron will go to Paraguay

headline.main: ARGENTINE EXILE SEES RIGHTS LAG; Prominent Opponent of Peron Says Return of Freedom Will Be Delayed

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 26 -- Many Argentine political and military refugees in Uruguay preparing to return to their country had more sober thoughts today about the revolutionary change in Buenos Aires.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 27 -- Argentina's provisional President, Maj. Gen. Eduardo Lonardi, dismissed Gen. Juan D. Peron today as a threat to the new regime and said that Paraguay could have him any time.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 27 -- Argentina's provisional President, Maj. Gen. Eduardo Lonardi, dismissed Gen. Juan D. Peron today as a threat to the new regime and said that Paraguay could have him any time.
docs.abstract: says Peron may leave any time; hints Paraguay is responsible for delay; seen confirming repts Paraguay sets conditions

headline.main: LONARDI ASSERTS PERON CAN LEAVE; Stand of Argentine President Seems to Confirm Reports Paraguay Is Reluctant
